rComments: It definitely helped that I was very interested in the subject, but I thought Prof. Fournier was an amazing teacher and would take another of his classes in a heartbeat.  Interesting lectures, not insanely hard assignments, 10/10.

He's very approachable outside class, though his con/crit on essays can be pretty harsh even if you get a decent mark. The lectures were clear and easy to follow, but he does have the habit of reading from his notes sometimes. The take home is also pretty tough, however if you show up to class and do the readings you'll be fine.

The Holocaust is a morbid albeit interesting topic. When this guy gives his lectures, he doesn't appear to be remotely enthused by the subject matter (on which he did his PhD). He's monotone and throws a bunch of numbers that don't matter your way which wastes a lot of time on mundane things. My biggest critique is that he lacks passion.

His lectures are extremely boring, and half the time it is hard to even make out what he is saying. He does answer his emails quickly, but has no email etiquette and is very rude when you approach him. Average amount of work except for the take home which was four essays. Would recommend trying to get into Grabowski's Holocaust class instead.
